Key Match Events: Gavin Williams tossed seven innings of one-hit ball to lead the Guardians to a 4-2 win over the Royals.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised Williams' performance and noted the importance of the bullpen's support.
Lane Thomas slugged his first homer as a Guardian with a two-run blast in the fifth.
Josh Naylor blasted a two-run shot, notching his 100th RBI of 2024.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gavin Williams' performance was his longest outing of the season and the first time he allowed one hit or fewer in a start longer than five innings.
Williams' seven-inning gem was just the seventh time this season a Cleveland starter went at least seven frames.
The Guardians' rotation now has a 4.58 ERA, which ranks 24th in the Majors.
Matthew Boyd and Alex Cobb have helped stabilize Cleveland's rotation recently.
Williams' fastball always jumps, and he can run it up near 100 mph pretty much all game.
